front.title: Glue In DNS Referral Responses Is Not Optional

abstract.t: The DNS uses glue records to allow iterative clients to find the addresses of nameservers that are contained within a delegated zone. Servers are expected to return available glue records in referrals. If message size constraints prevent the inclusion of glue records in a UDP response, the server MUST set the TC flag to inform the client that the response is incomplete, and that the client SHOULD use TCP to retrieve the full response.
